title: Washington State Dependents Tuition Waiver
summary: Full tuition and fees waiver for up to 200 quarter credits (or equivalent semester credits) for children and spouses/surviving spouses of 100% disabled or deceased veterans at Washington public colleges and universities.

requirements.notes: Veteran must be 100% P&T disabled, OR died as result of service, OR MIA/POW. Veteran must be Washington domiciliary.

eligibilityNotes: Children: ages 17-26. Spouses/surviving spouses: 10 years from date of death, disability rating, or POW/MIA determination. Waiver covers ALL undergraduate tuition and fees. Book stipend of $500/year if funds appropriated by legislature. Graduate credits encouraged but not required.

title: Washington Veteran Tuition Waiver
summary: State community colleges, colleges and universities may waive some or all tuition and fees for eligible wartime veterans.

requirements.notes: Must have served overseas during wartime or in international waters. Each institution sets own guidelines.

eligibilityNotes: Available to Washington resident veterans who served in war or conflict on foreign soil or international waters. Contact individual institutions for specific waiver amounts and application process.

title: Property Tax Exemption for Disabled Veterans and Surviving Spouses
summary: Washington offers property tax relief for qualifying disabled veterans and eligible surviving spouses based on income and disability status.

requirements.notes: Eligibility also depends on income thresholds and residency. Exemption amount varies based on income level.

eligibilityNotes: Apply through the local County Assessor. Income limits apply and are adjusted periodically. Unremarried surviving spouses may qualify.

title: Washington Veterans Employment Preference
summary: Veterans and eligible spouses receive preference points (5% or 10%) when applying for Washington state and local government jobs.

requirements.notes: Non-combat veterans: 5% added to exam score. Combat veterans: 10% added. Mobilized Guard/Reserve: 5%.

eligibilityNotes: Applies to qualifying veterans, surviving spouses, and registered domestic partners of eligible veterans. Honorably discharged combat veterans or those with campaign ribbon receive preference. Surviving spouses of veterans with service-connected P&T disability also eligible.

title: Washington State Parks Lifetime Disabled Veteran Pass
summary: Lifetime free access to Washington State Parks for qualifying disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Pass provides free day-use access to state parks; camping discounts may apply.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans must provide proof of disability and residency. Apply through Washington State Parks.

title: Reduced-Fee Hunting and Fishing Licenses for Disabled Veterans
summary: Washington offers discounted hunting and fishing licenses for veterans with qualifying service-connected disabilities.

requirements.notes: License eligibility and discounts vary by license type.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans must be Washington residents and provide VA disability documentation.

title: Veteran Designation on Washington Driver License / ID
summary: Veterans may add a Veteran designation to a Washington driver license or identification card.

requirements.notes: Requires proof of honorable service such as DD-214.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans must present documentation at a Department of Licensing office.

title: Washington State Veterans Homes
summary: Long-term care facilities providing nursing and rehabilitation services for eligible veterans and certain spouses.

requirements.notes: Admission depends on medical need, eligibility determination, and bed availability.

eligibilityNotes: Applicants must meet VA and Washington eligibility criteria. Spouses may be eligible in limited circumstances. Homes located throughout Washington state.

title: Washington State Veterans Cemetery
summary: State-operated veterans cemetery in Medical Lake providing burial options for eligible veterans and family members at no charge for veterans ($300 for eligible dependents).

requirements.notes: Eligibility generally mirrors VA national cemetery eligibility. No residency requirement.

eligibilityNotes: Washington State Veterans Cemetery located in Medical Lake. Veterans eligible for VA national cemetery are eligible. No charge for veteran interments, one-time $300 fee for eligible dependents. 30-minute committal service provided.
